solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (288 + 96 + 192) = 1152 dm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 3135 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=35 cm, h=11 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2640 + 2200 + 276.57 = 5116.57 cm^2\)

content.text: In the hollow cylinder below, Inner Radius =10 cm, Outer Radius = 12 cm, Height = 35 cm, find its surface area
Find the surface area of the objects below:

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.4^2 = 58.8 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.4^2 cm^2 = 1.96 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 58.8 - 19.6 = 39.2 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 9 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(39.2 \times 9\)
= Rs. 352.8

content.text: Five cubes of edge 1.4 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 9 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 2166= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {2166}{6}} \right) = 19 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 2166 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (35 \times 13 + 13 \times 7 + 35 \times 7) = 1582 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.2 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1582 \times 1.2\)
= Rs. 1898.4

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.2 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(35 cm \times 13 cm \times 7 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 936 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(936 m^2\)
Therefore, \(936 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{936}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 3 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {7}2 \times 49 = 1078 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 1078 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 50 rolls \(= 1078 \times 50 = 53900 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 49 cm and its diameter is 7 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 50 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (5 \times 3 + 3 \times 7 + 5 \times 7) = 142 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 6 boxes \(= 142 \times 6\)
\(= 852 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(5 cm \times 3 cm \times 7 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 6 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box
